sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Our overheating world. Scientists warn global temperatures are likely to surge to record levels in the next five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The World Meteorological Organization has warned global temperatures are likely to surge to record levels in the next five years, fueled by heat-trapping greenhouse gases and a naturally occurring El Nino event, where surface waters in the eastern Pacific Ocean become unusually warm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The WMO predicts a 66% chance that the annual global surface temperature will temporarily exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels sometime in the next five years, and forecasts a 98% chance of a record-breaking high temperature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It also estimates El Nino and climate change together will fuel global temperature increase and Arctic heating is predicted to be more than three times higher than the global average.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This report does not mean that we will permanently exceed the 1.5 degree level specified in the Paris Agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, the WMO is sounding the alarm that we will breach the 1.5 degree level on a temporary basis with increasing frequency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Higher temperatures will have far-reaching repercussions for health, food security, water management and the environment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The update says we need to be prepared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It goes on to discuss how to strengthen weather and climate services to support climate change adaptation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And it aims to stimulate discussion on prioritising new initiatives to protect people from increasingly extreme weather.

In most member states, E.U. election campaigns are about internal politics. But in recent years, there's a trend towards some of the bigger European issues.
